column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: Just after war broke out in 2011, we mobilised to bring humanitarian aid to families who had just arrived in Egypt, Jordan, Lebanon, Iraq, Greece and the Balkans, in camps or host communities, or on migration routes. This generally involves basic necessities and emergency psychological support. Over time and as the conflict evolves, the needs of children and families change and new issues emerge. In collaboration with local partners, our teams work with refugee children and families and host communities to uphold children’s rights. Together, we fight against the negative impacts of this humanitarian crisis on them, like poverty, violence, child exploitation, early marriage, or school drop-out. Tdh is also building the capacities of local organisations, community members and the authorities for sustainable improvement. Our teams are currently helping Syrian refugee children in six countries in the Middle East and Europe. #Syria10 📰 Read more about our projects here: www.tdh.ch/en/news/10-years-war-syria-between-pain-and-hope:=:https://www.tdh.ch/en/news/10-years-war-syria-between-pain-and-hope
column46: #SYRIA 10 6 countries in the Middle East and Europe in which Tdh helps Syrian refugee children

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: Après que la guerre a éclaté en 2011, nous nous sommes mobilisés pour apporter une aide humanitaire aux familles qui venaient d’arriver en Egypte, en Jordanie, au Liban, en Irak, en Grèce et dans les Balkans. Nous avons commencé à travailler dans les camps, les communautés d’accueil et sur les routes migratoires en fournissant notamment du matériel de première nécessité, du soutien psychologique d’urgence, et en créant des espaces dédiés aux enfants. Au fil du temps et de l’évolution du conflit, les besoins des enfants et des familles changent et de nouvelles problématiques émergent. En collaboration avec des partenaires locaux, nos équipes travaillent avec les enfants, les familles réfugiés et les communautés d’accueil pour faire respecter les droits des enfants. Ensemble, nous luttons contre les impacts négatifs de cette crise humanitaire, comme la pauvreté, la violence, l’exploitation des enfants, le mariage précoce, la déscolarisation. Terre des hommes développe également les compétences des organisations locales, des membres des communautés et des autorités pour un impact durable. Actuellement, les équipes de Tdh viennent directement en aide aux enfants réfugiés syriens dans six pays du Moyen-Orient et d’Europe. #Syria10 📰 Apprenez-en plus sur nos projets: www.tdh.ch/fr/actualite/dix-ans-guerre-syrie-entre-souffrance-et-espoir:=:https://www.tdh.ch/fr/actualite/dix-ans-guerre-syrie-entre-souffrance-et-espoir
column46: #SYRIA 10 6 pays du Moyen Orient et d'Europe dans lesquels Tdh vient en aide aux enfants réfugiés syriens

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: Nach dem Kriegsausbruch im Jahr 2011 engagierten wir uns, um Familien humanitäre Hilfe zu leisten, die in Ägypten, Jordanien, Libanon, Griechenland, im Irak und auf dem Balkan neu angekommen waren. Wir begannen, in Flüchtlingslagern, in den Aufnahmegemeinschaften und auf den Migrationsrouten zu arbeiten, wobei wir insbesondere Güter des täglichen Bedarfs und psychologische Soforthilfe bereitstellten und spezielle Räume für Kinder schufen. Im Laufe der Zeit und der Entwicklung des Konflikts verändern sich die Bedürfnisse von Kindern und Familien und es tauchen neue Probleme auf. In Zusammenarbeit mit lokalen Partnern arbeiten unsere Teams mit den Kindern, den Flüchtlingsfamilien und den Aufnahmegemeinschaften, um zu gewährleisten, dass die Kinderrechte eingehalten werden. Zusammen mit ihnen bekämpfen wir die negativen Auswirkungen dieser humanitären Krise: Armut, Gewalt, Ausbeutung von Kindern, Kinderehen, Schulabbruch. Tdh entwickelt zudem die Kompetenzen von lokalen Organisationen, von Angehörigen der Gemeinschaften und Behörden, um eine nachhaltige Wirkung zu erzielen. Heute leisten Teams von Tdh in Nahost und Europa in sechs Ländern Direkthilfe für Flüchtlingskinder. #Syria10 📰 Lesen Sie mehr über unsere Projekte:: www.tdh.ch/de/aktualit:=:https://www.tdh.ch/de/aktualität/zehn-jahre-krieg-syrien-zwischen-leid-und-hoffnung
column46: #SYRIA 10 6 Länder im Nahen Osten und Europa, in denen Tdh syrischen Flüchtlings- kindern hilft

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: "The road from Syria to Greece wasn't easy for us. After all we went through during the war, we found ourselves on the street, homeless, before arriving at this camp. One of my children has autism. He suffered a lot and was seriously injured. Terre des hommes has been very supportive, helping us to find a psychiatrist, a hospital, and to undergo medical examinations. They also help us with food, as we don't have enough money." These precarious living conditions were aggravated with the arrival of Covid-19: "Before the pandemic, we had a normal life here in the camp, the children went to school. Now we are locked down in the container." - Marwa lives with her children in a refugee camp near Athens, Greece. #Syria10 🙏🏼 Please donate to support children and their families affected by the war in Syria www.tdh.ch/donate/syria:=:https://www.tdh.ch/en/nous-soutenir/donner/urgence?urgence=19250&montant=50
column46: The road from Syria to Greece wasn't easy for us. After all we went through during the war, we found ourselves on the street, homeless, before arriving at this camp. " #SYRIA 10 Marwa lives with her children in refugee camp near Athens, Greece

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: «La route de la Syrie à la Grèce n'a pas été facile pour nous. Après tout ce que nous avons vécu pendant la guerre, nous nous sommes retrouvés à la rue, sans abri, avant d’arriver dans ce camp. Un de mes enfants a des troubles de l’autisme. Il a beaucoup souffert et s'est gravement blessé. Terre des hommes nous a apporté un grand soutien, nous a permis de trouver un psychiatre, un hôpital, et de passer des examens médicaux. Ils nous aident aussi avec la nourriture, car nous n'avons pas assez d'argent.» Ces conditions de vie précaires ont été aggravées avec l’arrivée du Covid-19: «Avant la pandémie, nous avions un semblant de vie normale ici dans le camp, les enfants allaient à l'école. Maintenant, nous sommes enfermés dans le container.» - Marwa vit avec ses enfants dans un camp de réfugié·e·s près d’Athènes, en Grèce. #Syria10 🙏🏼 Faites un don pour soutenir les enfants et leurs familles victimes de la guerre en Syrie. www.tdh.ch/donner/syrie:=:https://www.tdh.ch/fr/nous-soutenir/donner/urgence?urgence=737&montant=50
column46: " La route de la Syrie à la Grèce n'a pas été facile pour nous. Après tout ce que nous avons vécu pendant la guerre, nous nous sommes retrouvés à la rue, sans abri, avant d'arriver dans ce camp. " #SYRIA 10 Marwa vit avec ses enfants dans un camp réfugiés près d'Athènes, en Grèce

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: «Die Reise von Syrien nach Griechenland war für uns nicht einfach. Nach allem, was wir während des Krieges erlebt hatten, fanden wir uns als Obdachlose auf der Strasse wieder, bevor wir in diesem Lager ankamen. Eines meiner Kinder hat Autismus. Es hat viel gelitten und sich schwer verletzt. Terre des hommes hat uns grosse Hilfe geleistet und uns ermöglicht, einen Psychiater und ein Spital zu finden, um medizinische Untersuchungen zu machen. Sie haben uns auch mit Lebensmitteln geholfen, denn wir haben oft nicht genug Geld.» Diese prekären Lebensbedingungen haben sich mit Covid-19 noch verschlimmert: «Vor der Pandemie hatten wir hier im Lager so etwas wie ein normales Leben, die Kinder gingen zur Schule. Jetzt sind wir im Wohncontainer eingeschlossen.» - Marwa lebt mit ihren Kindern in einem Flüchtlingslager in der Nähe von Athen, Griechenland. #Syria10 🙏🏼 Spenden Sie, um Kinder und ihre Familien zu unterstützen, die vom Krieg in Syrien betroffen sind. www.tdh.ch/spenden/syrien:=:https://www.tdh.ch/de/nous-soutenir/donner/urgence?urgence=19251&montant=50

column43: W., from Pakistan, has been under the care of The HOME Project for the past three years. He learnt Greek and English, and due to his willingness to study he has been granted a scholarship at ACS Athens (American Community Schools). Being very communicative, he often volunteered to translate for the other children, ensuring the smooth running of activities in the shelter. Today, as a young adult, he has been moved to the 18+ shelter of The HOME Project and has been hired as care giver in one of our shelters. His story is an example of social inclusion achieved through tailored support and equal access to opportunities. We are proud of him. #nochildalone Ο W., από το Πακιστάν, λαμβάνει τη φροντίδα του The HOME Project τα τελευταία τρία χρόνια. Λόγω της θέλησης του να σπουδάσει έλαβε υποτροφία στο ACS Athens (American Community Schools) όπου έμαθε ελληνικά και αγγλικά. Είναι πολύ επικοινωνιακός και συχνά εθελοντικά υποστήριζε ως διερμηνέας τα υπόλοιπα παιδιά του ξενώνα διασφαλίζοντας έτσι την ομαλή λειτουργία του. Σήμερα, ως νεαρός ενήλικας, φιλοξενείται στον ξενώνα 18+ του The HOME Project και εργάζεται ως φροντιστής σε έναν από τους ξενώνες μας. Η ιστορία του αποτελεί παράδειγμα κοινωνικής ένταξης και πως μπορεί να επιτευχθεί μέσω της εξατομικευμένης υποστήριξης και πρόσβασης σε ίσες ευκαιρίες. Είμαστε περήφανοι για αυτόν. #nochildalone

column43: In West Bengal, India, girls are particularly affected by the risks of migration, sex trafficking, violence or early marriage. Tdh uses Kabaddi, a traditional, mainly male sport, to empower them. Kabaddi helps girls improve their self-confidence, communication skills, collaboration, stress management and critical thinking. Boys also participate in activities to prevent discrimination and violence. They too can identify and report cases of gender-based violence and take action to address them. On 22 January, the 2nd annual Kabaddi tournament for girls took place, a great victory for these young people. 🔗 www.tdh.ch/en/projects/kabaddi-sport-empowers-girls-india:=:https://www.tdh.ch/en/projects/kabaddi-sport-empowers-girls-india
column46: LASTICS EASE "During the game, the girls become able to challenge their fear and learn to make their voices heard." Soma Das Project Manager Child Protection, Gender and Diversity in India
column47: Photos from Terre des hommes's post

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: Au Bengale occidental indien, les filles sont particulièrement touchées par les risques de la migration, le trafic sexuel, la violence ou le mariage précoce. Tdh utilise le Kabaddi, un sport traditionnel essentiellement masculin, afin de leur donner les moyens d'action pour pouvoir s’émanciper. Le Kabaddi aide les filles à améliorer leur confiance en soi, leurs compétences en communication, la collaboration, la gestion du stress et la pensée critique. Les garçons participent aussi à des activités pour prévenir la discrimination et la violence. Ils peuvent eux aussi identifier et signaler les cas de violence sexiste et prendre des mesures pour y remédier. Le 22 janvier a eu lieu le 2e tournoi annuel de Kabaddi pour les filles, une belle victoire pour ces jeunes. 🔗 www.tdh.ch/fr/projets/kabaddi-inde-permettre-filles-semanciper-sport:=:https://www.tdh.ch/fr/projets/kabaddi-inde-permettre-filles-semanciper-sport
column46: De nombreux pères qui étaient initialement réticents au projet ont compris son importance. Certains ont annulé es mariages préarrangés de leurs filles.

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: In Westbengalen, Indien, sind Mädchen besonders von den Risiken der Migration, des Sexhandels, der Gewalt oder der Kinderheirat betroffen. Tdh nutzt Kabaddi, eine traditionelle, hauptsächlich männerdominierte Sportart, um sie zu stärken. Kabaddi hilft den Mädchen, ihr Selbstvertrauen, ihre Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, ihre Zusammenarbeit, ihr Stressmanagement und ihr kritisches Denken zu verbessern. Jungen nehmen auch an Aktivitäten zur Prävention von Diskriminierung und Gewalt teil. Auch sie können Fälle von geschlechtsspezifischer Gewalt erkennen, melden und Massnahmen ergreifen, um diese zu bekämpfen. Am 22. Januar fand das 2. jährliche Kabaddi-Turnier für Mädchen statt, ein grosser Erfolg für diese Jugendlichen. 🔗 www.tdh.ch/de/projekte/kabaddi-ein-sport-der-maedchen-indien-staerkt:=:https://www.tdh.ch/de/projekte/kabaddi-ein-sport-der-maedchen-indien-staerkt
column46: LASTICS EASE "Während des Spiels können die Mädchen ihre Angst herausfordern und lernen, sich Gehör zu verschaffen." Soma Das Projektleiterin Kinderschutz, Gender und Diversity in Indien

column43: In Burundi, we work in rehabilitation centres to help young people to reconnect with their communities through collective sports activities. Sport helps young people to manage their emotions. Group games also enable children to acquire social skills by developing relationships of respect and solidarity among themselves and with their educators. They also integrate these values into their daily lives. #IDSDP2021
column46: "What motivates me is to see the development of life skills of these children and their change in behaviour. Sport has transformed these young people." Vincent Tuhabonye Advisor in child protection

Le sport aide les jeunes à gérer leurs émotions. Les jeux en groupe permettent également aux enfants d’acquérir des compétences sociales en développant des relations de respect et de solidarité entre eux et avec leurs éducateurs. Ils intègrent aussi ces valeurs dans leur vie quotidienne. #IDSDP2021
column46: «ce qui me motive, c'est de voir le développement des compétences de ces enfants et leur changement de comportement. Le sport a transformé ces jeunes.»> Vincent Tuhabonye Conseiller en protection de l'enfance

column43: In Burundi arbeiten wir in Haftanstalten, um jungen Menschen zu helfen, durch gemeinsame sportliche Aktivitäten wieder Anschluss an ihre Gemeinschaften zu finden. Sport hilft diesen jungen Menschen, ihre Emotionen zu kontrollieren. Gruppenspiele ermöglichen es ihnen auch, soziale Fähigkeiten zu erwerben, indem sie Beziehungen von Respekt und Solidarität untereinander und mit ihren BetreuerInnen entwickeln. Sie integrieren diese Werte auch in ihrem täglichen Leben. #IDSDP2021

column43: For the last project in our sports series, we are headed to Colombia. To prevent the recruitment of children by gangs and armed groups, our staff used 'Golombiao', also called the 'game of peace'. This football-like sport promotes non-violence and equality. Today, these rules of play have been applied to other sports such as basketball and volleyball, reaching thousands of children. #IDSDP2021
column46: ‎10 people, ‎people playing sports and people standing, ‎'‎1mka م Û In Golombiao, rule 1 is equality. Both teams are made up of the same number of girls and boys and goals must be scored in turn.‎'‎‎‎

column43: Pour le dernier projet de notre série sportive, nous partons en Colombie. Pour prévenir le recrutement des enfants par les gangs et les groupes armés, notre staff a utilisé le «Golombiao», aussi appelé le «jeu de la paix». Ce sport qui ressemble au football permet de promouvoir la non-violence et l'égalité. Aujourd’hui, ces règles de jeu ont pu être appliquées à d’autres sports comme le basketball et le volley, touchant des milliers d’enfants. #IDSDP2021
column46: ke A Û Dans le Golombiao, la règle n°1 est l'égalité. Les deux équipes sont constituées du même nombre de filles et de garçons et les buts doivent être marqués à tour de rôle.

column43: Für das letzte Projekt unserer Sportserie gehen wir nach Kolumbien. Um die Rekrutierung von Kindern durch Banden und bewaffnete Gruppen zu verhindern, nutzten unsere Mitarbeitenden das "Golombiao", ein Friedensspiel. Dieser Sport ist ähnlich wie Fussball und fördert Gewaltlosigkeit und Gleichberechtigung. Heute wurden diese Regeln auf andere Sportarten wie Basketball und Volleyball übertragen und erreichen so Tausende von Kindern.

With individualized support and care, they have regained self-confidence, built healthy relationships in the shelter and at school, and started dreaming about their future. We are proud of their progress and in this new phase we will be next to them with the same dedication. #nochildalone

column43: 🏆 We are SO proud, happy and grateful to have won the Popular Vote prize of World Justice Project's Challenge with our project “Accelerate Release of Children; Protect Children from COVID-19”! The project has led to the emergency release and reintegration care of hundreds of children worldwide. It has also boosted concrete child justice sector reform measures to make systems more resilient when facing crises and supported the empowerment of child justice actors, including children. Thank you to all of you who supported and voted for us, and for a justice with and for children 🧡 https://worldjusticeproject.org/world-justice-challenge-2021/accelerate-release-children-protect-children-covid-19
column48:
❗️ 𝗪𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗵𝗲𝗹𝗽, 𝗽𝗹𝗲𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝘃𝗼𝘁𝗲 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝘂𝘀 ❗️

Our project "Accelerate Release of Children; Protect Children from COVID-19" is running for the World Justice Project's Challenge.

Children and youth are entitled to fundamental rights including the right to have access to justice. Yet, many of them face challenges accessing this right, a situation that has been worsened with the COVID-19 pandemic.

Tdh's project "Accelerate Release of Children; Protect Children from COVID-19" is the only project submitted to the World Justice Challenge 2021 linked to the rights of children and young people. As they make up nearly half of the world's population, we must take more action to ensure the realisation of their fundamental rights.

By voting for our project, you can help!

Here is how:

1⃣ Join the World Justice Challenge 2021 Community Forum here: https://community.worldjusticeproject.org

2⃣  Request a ballot through this form: https://survey.alchemer.com/s3/6230241/World-Justice-Challenge-2021-Ballot-Registration-Form

3⃣ Place your vote for Terres des hommes's project “Accelerate Release of Children; Protect Children from Covid-19”.

𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗿𝗲𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁 𝗮 𝗯𝗮𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗿𝗼𝘄, 𝟮𝟵𝘁𝗵 𝗔𝗽𝗿𝗶𝗹 𝟮𝟬𝟮𝟭.

We are grateful for your support.

column43: On World Humanitarian Day, we pay tribute to our shelter staff, our everyday heroes standing by the children we care for with self-sacrifice, care and love. We salute the resilience of children caught in various conflicts throughout the world and reaffirm our commitment to support and provide child protection services to lone children in Greece. The HOME Project has supported more than 520 children with the provision of a holistic network of child protection services in our shelters including psychological, pedagogical, legal and social support as well as education and employment opportunities when reaching adulthood. #nochildalone #refugee #children #WorldHumanitarianDay

column43: Getting ready for the school year to begin. According to the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child (Article 28a) “Every child has the right to education. Specifically, States Parties recognize the right of the child to education, and with a view to achieving this right progressively and on the basis of equal opportunity, they shall make primary education compulsory and available free to all.” At @HomeProjectOrg all children obtain immediate access to education and participate in a wide range of educational activities implemented in collaboration with high quality academic institutions and individual volunteer educators in our shelters. #nochildalone #educationforall

column43: Together with other civil society organizations, we call on the Greek government to urgently provide assistance to people who were forced to leave from Moria camp last night after multiple fires broke out in the camp and destroyed it. The safe transfer to the mainland of groups at-risk, including unaccompanied children, should be prioritized and proper conditions of quarantine for the people who tested positive for Covid-19 should be ensured. We urge the Greek authorities to work on a coherent plan to maximize all available resources including EU assistance and we reiterate our call to the European leaders to share the responsibility for the reception and support of lone refugee children. #nochildalone Read our statement here https://www.homeproject.org/en/on-the-ground/voices/greece-transfer-refugees-and-asylum-seekers-to-safety-on-mainland/

Speeding up family reunifications procedures for eligible cases and relocations to other European countries are equally important. #nochildalone

column43: We are thrilled to announce the opening of our new shelter for unaccompanied girls and minor mothers with their babies. Two more shelters for unaccompanied boys will open soon after. The shelters will develop as part of the Greek-Dutch program to strengthen the reception and guardianship capacity of unaccompanied minor asylum seekers in Greece through the collaboration of The HOME Project and Movement On The Ground. The HOME Project will be in charge of the operations and provision of child protection services within the shelters while Movement On The Ground will oversee the operations of the facilities and contribute with extra-curricular activities for the children. #nochildalone You can read our full announcement here: https://www.homeproject.org/en/on-the-ground/press-releases/the-home-project-partners-with-movement-on-the-ground-to-open-three-new-shelters/ Με χαρά ανακοινώνουμε τη λειτουργία άνοιγμα του νέου μας ξενώνα που θα φιλοξενήσει ανήλικα κορίτσια και ανήλικες μητέρες με τα μωρά τους. Δύο ακόμη ξενώνες για ασυνόδευτα αγόρια θα ανοίξουν αμέσως μετά. Οι ξενώνες υλοποιούνται από κοινού από την Ολλανδική και την Ελληνική κυβέρνηση στο πλαίσιο του προγράμματος για την ενίσχυση της υποδοχής και φιλοξενίας ασυνόδευτων ανηλίκων στην Ελλάδα. Η «The HOME Project» θα είναι υπεύθυνη για τη λειτουργία και την παροχή υπηρεσιών παιδικής προστασίας εντός των ξενώνων ενώ η «Movement On The Ground» αναλαμβάνει τη λειτουργία των εγκαταστάσεων και θα συνεισφέρει με εξωσχολικές δραστηριότητες για τα παιδιά.

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: A story from 🇧🇩 for #WorldRefugeeDay 9-year-old Adil lives in the Kutupalong Refugee Camp in Bangladesh. "Two years ago, I fled from Myanmar to Bangladesh. We experienced horrible things in Myanmar and on our journey to here. The images stayed in my mind, and that made me nervous and scared. I couldn’t trust anyone.” Adil regularly takes part in the activities we organise in one of the centres for children of the refugee camp. At the beginning, our team noticed that he was always alone and didn’t want to play with the other children. “After some time, I became friends with Arshad and Saber [two Tdh staff] and started trusting them. Now I have many friends and am not scared anymore. We have many games and things to do here." In the refugee camps in Bangladesh, our teams set up child-friendly spaces where children can take part in recreational, sports and creative activities in a safe environment. We provide psychosocial support to help them deal with their fears and emotions. Learn more about our work in the refugee camps of Bangladesh: www.tdh.ch/en/projects/rohingya-crisis-surviving-camps-coxs-bazar:=:https://www.tdh.ch/en/projects/rohingya-crisis-surviving-camps-coxs-bazar

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column43: A story from 🇬🇷 for #WorldRefugeeDay Marzia is 25 and comes from Iran. She lives in the refugee camp of Koutsochero, in Greece. Three years ago, she escaped from her abusive husband, taking her 2 and 4-year-old children with her. "Sometimes in our lives we have to make brave decisions. There was no other choice," she said. The three of them ended up on a boat that took them to Greece. "I will never forget the sea... We were so scared!” Things were difficult at first: "I was a woman alone with two kids in a foreign country." Until she met Reza who is also from Iran. They got married and now they have a baby together. "Today I feel a lot better," she told us. "Reza played a big role in that. He is good and smart, he has manners and he knows how to treat us". Reza, who speaks Greek, is helping his wife learn the language too. "The only one I miss is my mother," Marzia tells us. "Everything and everyone else I need I have them right here.” The whole family has been granted refugee status. "Tdh has helped us a lot with the whole process. They helped me take full custody of my children, they stood by us in every way possible, they are very kind to us. All we are waiting for now is our travel documents. I want to say a big thank you” Marzia says, placing her hand over her heart.

column43: A story from 🇪🇬 for #WorldRefugeeDay "I was four years old when I left Syria. I remember my street and a small market where we often went to buy things. I also remember the tank that was stationed near our house and from which we hid. Here in Egypt, we are safe, we can have a stable life. When we arrived from Syria, people were nice and welcomed us. But I wish my grandparents, my cousins and my aunts and uncles could be with us. "At the age of 12, Bakr recalls the few memories he has of his native Syria. Eight years ago, his family left everything behind to escape the civil war that was ravaging the country. With his parents and two brothers, Talal, 11, and Adam, 4, he now lives in a tiny flat in a neighbourhood an hour's drive from central Cairo. Part of Terre des hommes' work in Egypt focuses on psychological support for children and young people. Our protection specialists develop activity programmes to accompany refugee children according to their needs and age. "During the Terre des hommes activities, you learn a lot through very simple exercises. What I like best are the activities that keep everyone busy. They make the children happy, while some children have no one to make them happy." www.tdh.ch/en/news/10-years-war-syria-between-pain-and-hope:=:https://www.tdh.ch/en/news/10-years-war-syria-between-pain-and-hope

column18: We improve the lives of vulnerable children by funding, elevating and educating the most effective changemakers for children worldwide.
column43: This International Women’s Day we recognize and celebrate all of our women leaders and Heroes like Winnifred Selby who are empowering young women and girls by giving them the tools and opportunities for education and vocational skills to change their narrative. Winnifred founded Educational Empowerment Initiative in Ghana as a teenager. She realized girls were missing a week of school each month due to their menstrual cycle and the stigma behind it. She started Menstrual Pads for Dignity providing free disposable menstrual products, private sanitary bathrooms at schools, as well as providing hygiene, reproductive, and financial education for girls resulting in drastic reduction of absenteeism in school. Winnifred recently founded the W3 Initiative led by girls for girls which empowers young women with skills to break cultural limitation to achieve their goals. We applaud our 2015 Youth Honoree for empowering so many girls giving them hope for a better future !

column18: We improve the lives of vulnerable children by funding, elevating and educating the most effective changemakers for children worldwide.
column43: This #WorldWaterDay we recognize and celebrate Ryan Hreljac,  2003 Youth Honoree and 2016 Hero Award  recipient for his lifetime commitment to providing access to clean water & sanitation projects and hygiene education in the poorest regions of developing countries. Ryan started this mission at age six! He founded @ryanswellfoundation and 20 years later, he along with with local partners has built 1,531 water projects, 1,267 latrines, giving 1,109,133 people access to clean water.  In addition, despite the effects of the pandemic last year, Ryan's Wells managed to complete 40 water projects, 4 latrine stations, providing water and sanitation to over 60,000 people in Ghana and Uganda in 2020! We salute our World of Children HERO for empowering so many communities and unlocking the future for so many vulnerable children!!

column43: This week, we learned the wonderful news that a child under our care will be reunited with his brother in Germany. After 3 rejections, The HOME Project legal team managed to secure family reunification approval for the child. This was also made possible through a collaboration with Equal Rights Beyond Borders, a German NGO that provides legal aide to asylum seekers. Every unaccompanied minors deserves to be reunited with their family. At The HOME Project, we strive for this by providing children with assiduous legal support as part of our Child Protection Model. #NoChildAlone Αυτή την εβδομάδα, μάθαμε υπέροχα νέα για ένα από τα παιδιά που βρίσκεται στη φροντίδα μας ότι θα επανενωθεί με τον αδερφό του στη Γερμανία. Μετά από 3 απορρίψεις, η νομική ομάδα της The HOME Project κατάφερε να εξασφαλίσει την θετική απάντηση στο αίτημα οικογενειακή επανένωσης. Αυτό κατέστη δυνατό μέσω της συνεργασίας μας με το Equal Rights Beyond Borders, μια γερμανική ΜΚΟ που παρέχει νομική βοήθεια σε αιτούντες άσυλο. Κάθε ασυνόδευτος ανήλικος αξίζει να επανενωθεί με την οικογένειά του. Στη The HOME Project, προσπαθούμε να το επιτύχουμε παρέχοντας στα παιδιά πλήρη νομική υποστήριξη ως κομμάτι του μοντέλου παιδικής προστασίας που εφαρμόζουμε. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Our October newsletter has just been released. Click on the link below to check it out and subscribe to receive it every month. #NoChildAlone https://mailchi.mp/5c26e821e127/october-2020-newsletter
column46: THE HOME PROJECT #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Fabiola, an independent adult and mother, is ready to move into her own apartment. Just as The HOME Project cared for her when she stayed in a shelter, we are now supporting her in the transition to live on her own by helping her obtain all necessary documents she needs to be independent and have social inclusion opportunities. This makes up part of our commitment to social integration and pedagogical support. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Last week, two representatives from Γιατροί Χωρίς Σύνορα (MSF) - MSF Greece conducted sessions of personal and reproductive health education with children under our care. These lessons are vital for the proper growth of children everywhere. We are very grateful to Γιατροί Χωρίς Σύνορα (MSF) - MSF Greece for their work in providing these sessions. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: With the announcement of the nationwide lockdown, although we can’t stay home we reaffirm our commitment to the protection of all children we care for, placing special emphasis on the implementation of all safety measures for all the kids and our staff. During these times the feeling of belonging and sense of community are of vital importance. We will get through this together. #nochildalone Με την ανακοίνωση του εθνικού lockdown, παρόλο που δεν μπορούμε να μείνουμε σπίτι, επιβεβαιώνουμε τη δέσμευσή μας στην προστασία όλων των παιδιών που φροντίζουμε δίνοντας ιδιαίτερη έμφαση στην εφαρμογή των μέτρων ασφαλείας. Την περίοδο αυτή το αίσθημα του να ανήκεις και το αίσθημα της κοινότητας είναι ζωτικής σημασίας. Θα το περάσουμε όλοι μαζί.

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Children living at our Kallithea shelter visited the Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Center before the lockdown as part of an on ongoing art program. The program also included workshops which occurred over the last 2 months in the shelters. The workshops and the visit to the center were extremely valuable experiences for the children as their artistry was supplemented by examples of professional pieces. The HOME Project encourages opportunities like these for the children, and we are looking forward to more projects after the lockdown ends. #NoChildAlone Τα παιδιά που φιλοξενούνται στο ξενώνα μας στην Καλλιθέα κατάφεραν πριν το lockdown και επισκέφτηκαν το Stavros Niarchos Foundation Cultural Center ως μέρος ενός καλλιτεχνικού προγράμματος που συμμετείχαν. Το πρόγραμμα περιλάμβανε καλλιτεχνικά εργαστήρια που πραγματοποιήθηκαν τους τελευταίους 2 μήνες εντός του ξενώνα. Η επίσκεψη στο πολιτιστικό κέντρο ήταν εξαιρετικά πολύτιμη εμπειρία για τα παιδιά καθώς η γνώση που αποκόμισαν εμπλουτίστηκε με αληθινά παραδείγματα. H The HOME Project ενθαρρύνει ευκαιρίες όπως αυτές και ανυπομονεί για περισσότερα προγράμματα με τη λήξη του lockdown. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: We thank Οργάνωση Γη-Organization Earth for safely conducting the “Farmers in the City” program for children under our care while following all necessary COVID-19 safety guidelines. On October 30th, before the nationwide lockdown, children learned how to maintain a vegetable garden and took home herbs and horseshoes for good luck. Participation in partnership programs such as this are not only enjoyable, but they also provide the children with education on sustainability. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: As part of an organized response to the new wave of COVID-19 infections in Greece, IOM Greece provided Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) to the children in our shelters in coordination with the Special Secretary for the Protection of the Unaccompanied Minors Ministry of Migration & Asylum and with the funding scope and priorities of the U.S. Department of State: Bureau of Population, Refugees, and Migration. After a long day of transport and delivery, we managed to get all donations distributed to the shelters. The PPE will certainly help to create a safe environment for all children and staff #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Last month the first unaccompanied minor girls and mothers with their babies moved into Daphne shelter, the first of three safe and healing homes we have opened in collaboration with Movement On The Ground. The girls have started attending school, getting to know their neighborhood and Athens, while building relationships with the staff of the home and each other. We look forward to continuing to watch these girls grow and flourish in their new environment. We are also so humbled to be working alongside Movement on the Ground to contribute towards a compassionate and durable solution for unaccompanied children in Greece. #NoChildAlone In an effort to provide more safe and enabling environments for vulnerable lone children in Greece, Movement on the Ground and The HOME Project have partnered to open three shelters for unaccompanied minors in Athens. Τον περασμένο μήνα τα πρώτα ασυνόδευτα ανήλικα κορίτσια και ανήλικες μητέρες με τα μωρά τους έφτασαν στο ξενώνα Δάφνη, το πρώτο από τα τρία ασφαλή σπίτια και θεραπευτικά πλαίσια που ανοίξαμε σε συνεργασία με την Movement On The Ground. Τα κορίτσια άρχισαν τη φοίτηση τους στο σχολείο, τη γνωριμία τους με τη γειτονιά και την Αθήνα, ενώ παράλληλα δημιουργούν σχέσεις εμπιστοσύνης με το προσωπικό αλλά και μεταξύ τους. Ανυπομονούμε να τα δούμε να μεγαλώνουν και να ανθίζουν στο νέο τους περιβάλλον. Είμαστε χαρούμενοι για την συνεργασία μας με το Movement on the Ground με στόχο την επίτευξη μιας μόνιμης λύσης για τα ασυνόδευτα παιδιά στην Ελλάδα. #NoChildAlone Σε μια προσπάθεια να παρέχουν ασφαλές περιβάλλον για τα παιδιά που βρίσκονται στην Ελλάδα μόνα τους, το Movement On The Ground και το HOME Project συνεργάζονται για το άνοιγμα και τη λειτουργία τριών ξενώνων για ασυνόδευτους ανηλίκους στην Αθήνα.

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: We are very grateful to Ελληνικός Ερυθρός Σταυρός - Hellenic Red Cross for providing vaccinations for children under our care. This pandemic has shown how interdependent our world can be. Equal access to healthcare especially during these times is crucial not only for the wellbeing of the children we care for but for the whole of society. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: The HOME Project's Child Protection Unit has made a significant adaptation during the lockdown in the form of online capacity building sessions. This past week, members of the unit all participated in the monthly sessions both in Greek and English to ensure full understanding of the material. #NoChildAlone Η Μονάδα Παιδικής Προστασίας της The HOME Project προχώρησε σε μια σημαντική προσαρμογή κατά τη διάρκεια του lockdown μέσω διαδικτυακών εκπαιδεύσεων στο προσωπικό της οργάνωσης. Την περασμένη εβδομάδα, όλα τα μέλη συμμετείχαν στις μηνιαίες εκπαιδεύσεις που πραγματοποιήθηκαν στα ελληνικά αλλά και στα αγγλικά ώστε να διασφαλίσουν την πλήρη κατανόηση του υλικού εκπαίδευσης. #nochildalone
column46: ㅋ - Leave

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: The HOME Project is excited to announce that CEO Sofia Kouvelaki has been invited by LSESU United Nations Society to participate in a virtual conversation about our work and the current situation in Greece on Friday the 27th of November. We are looking forward to seeing her engage in conversation with young people who are bound to serve as future leaders, innovators, and change-makers. Click on the link to register for this event. http://tinyurl.com/unsochomeproject:=:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfgoqVXC01uNKJrIte8EuvmeC5g0eK7xkcpYRNu3uVzVPBsYw/viewform?usp=sf_link #nochildalone H The HOME Project ανακοινώνει με ιδιαίτερη χαρά τη πρόσκληση της Σοφίας Κουβελάκη, Γενικής Διευθύντριας, από το LSESU United Nations Society και τη συμμετοχή της σε μια διαδικτυακή συζήτηση σχετικά με το έργο του οργανισμού και την τρέχουσα κατάσταση στην Ελλάδα την Παρασκευή 27 Νοεμβρίου. Ανυπομονούμε να παρακολουθήσουμε τη συνομιλία της με νέες και νέους που θα είναι οι μελλοντικοί ηγέτες και φορείς αλλαγής και καινοτομίας. Ακολουθήστε το σύνδεσμο για να εγγραφείτε στην εκδήλωση. http://tinyurl.com/unsochomeproject:=:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfgoqVXC01uNKJrIte8EuvmeC5g0eK7xkcpYRNu3uVzVPBsYw/viewform?usp=sf_link #nochildalone
column46: UNSOC LSESU UNITED NATIONS SOCIETY IN CONVERSATION WITH HOME PROJECT HOME THE PRO PROJECT Friday 27th November 2-3 PM GMT Registration: https://tinyurl.com/ unsochomeproject

column18: We improve the lives of vulnerable children by funding, elevating and educating the most effective changemakers for children worldwide.
column43: On World Health Day we highlight a few of our many extraordinary Health Honorees for their heroic work in ensuring access to essential health care and life saving surgery to the most vulnerable children across the globe. We are so inspired and so grateful for all of our World of Children Heroes! @hearttoheartglobal @coaniquem_official @friendswithoutaborder @piel_asociacion @alegtostandon @foundationforthechildren @smilesforeverfoundation @casadelaamistadmex @losev1998 #WorldHealthDay #HealthHeroes #Grateful #WHWWeek

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: On World Children’s Day, we recognize the significance of children in all of our lives and the importance of providing them with compassion and care to ensure their right to a bright future. Despite the inalienable Rights of a Child, there are still 2,286 lone refugee children outside of a system of protection in Greece today. We must all work together to bring this number to 0. #worldchildrensday #nochildalone Σήμερα είναι η Παγκόσμια Ημέρα για τα Δικαιώματα του Παιδιού και αναγνωρίζουμε τη σημασία των παιδιών στη ζωές μας καθώς και τη σημασία να τους παρέχουμε κατάλληλη φροντίδα και τη διασφάλιση του δικαιώματος τους για ένα λαμπρό μέλλον. Παρά τα αναφαίρετα δικαιώματα του παιδιού, υπάρχουν σήμερα στην Ελλάδα 2.286 ασυνόδευτα παιδιά πρόσφυγες εκτός συστήματος παιδικής προστασίας. Χρειάζεται όλοι να συνεργαστούμε για να μηδενίζουμε αυτόν τον αριθμό. #worldchildrensday #nochildalone

column12: The New York Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Children (NYSPCC)
column43: Happy #FlashbackFriday everyone! Enjoy this NYSPCC Archive photo from 1916: children at The NYSPCC house enjoying some sunny indoor playtime. For more photos like this and to stay up to date with things happening at The Society, follow us on social media. . . . . . . . . . . #nyspcc #children #endchildabuse #endchildabusenow #saveachild #endabuse #WeCanPrevent #LetKidsBeKids #endit #archive #photography #history #vintage #film #photo #photoarchive #archives #archivestreasures #archival #sepia #blackandwhite #archivesofinstagram #timewarp #specialcollections #throwbacks #digitization #genealogy #Americanhistory #specialcollections

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: As we remain in a state of lockdown, students are continuing online lessons in the shelters. While online learning at home can be challenging at times, it can also foster collaboration and build closer bonds among those living together. The HOME Project remains dedicated to ensuring positive learning environments for all children under our care. #nochildalone Καθώς ακόμη βρισκόμαστε σε lockdown, οι μαθητές συνεχίζουν τα διαδικτυακά μαθήματα στους ξενώνες. Παρότι η διαδικτυακή μάθηση μπορεί να είναι πολλές φορές δύσκολη, μπορεί επίσης να ενισχύσει τη συνεργασία και να δημιουργήσει στενότερους δεσμούς μεταξύ των παιδιών που ζουν μαζί. Στη The HOME Project παραμένουμε αφοσιωμένοι στη διασφάλιση ενός θετικού περιβάλλοντος για όλα τα παιδιά που βρίσκονται στη φροντίδα μας. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Odyssea launches a new educational collaboration with The HOME Project by offering vocational training programs. The children had a chance to check out each program and select which one interested them before the lockdown began. Now, we are looking forward to returning back to normalcy and the beginning of the lessons. This partnership represents part of our commitment to the social inclusion of these children. #nochildalone Η Odyssea ξεκινά μια νέα εκπαιδευτική συνεργασία με τη The HOME Project προσφέροντας προγράμματα επαγγελματικής κατάρτισης. Η παρουσίαση των προγραμμάτων στους φιλοξενούμενους των ξενώνων της The ΗΟΜΕ Project έγινε πριν το lockdown, οι ενδιαφερόμενοι επέλεξαν το πρόγραμμα που τους ενδιέφερε και τώρα ανυπομονούν να επανέλθουμε στην κανονικότητα για να ξεκινήσουν τα μαθήματα. H συνεργασία αυτή αποτελεί μέρος της δέσμευσης μας για την κοινωνική ένταξη των παιδιών αυτών. #nochildalone

column18: Terre des hommes is the leading Swiss child relief agency, improving the lives of millions of the world's most vulnerable children. Visit www.tdh.ch or watch vimeo.com/253387418
column46: <IN LIGHT OF THE CURRENT PANDEMIC, TERRE DES HOMMES FOUNDATION (TDH) INTENSIFIES ITS EFFORTS TO ENSURE ACCESS TO BASIC HEALTH SERVICES AND MALARIA TREATMENT FOR PREGNANT WOMEN AND CHILDREN. IN 2020, TDH FACILITATED APPROPRIATE MALARIA DIAGNOSIS AND TREATMENT TO MORE THAN 1.62 MILLION CHILDREN IN BURKINA FASO.»> Iveth J. González Deputy Manager Health Programme Terre des Hommes Foundation
column48:
On the road to a #malaria -free world, our member organisations are making an indispensable contribution from #Switzerland. In view of #WorldMalariaDay, we introduce the people behind. Today, Iveth J. González from Terre des Hommes. 
Terre des hommes #endmalaria #healthforall #hoppschwiiz #allezlasuisse #forzasvizzera

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: As part of the Covid-19 response for Unaccompanied Minors coordinated by IOM Greece, representatives from the organization visited The HOME Project shelters to give information and provide answers to any questions surrounding the pandemic in Greece. We would like to extend a big thank you to IOM for their work and for conducting these information sessions. #nochildalone Εκπρόσωποι του IOM Greece επισκέφτηκαν τους ξενώνες της The HOME Project για να ενημερώσουν και να απαντήσουν σε ερωτήσεις των παιδιών σχετικά με την πανδημία στην Ελλάδα. Ευχαριστούμε θερμά τον IOM Greece για τη διεξαγωγή των ενημερωτικών επισκέψεων ως μέρος της αντιμετώπισης του Covid-19 στα ασυνόδευτα παιδιά. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: The holiday season is here and despite the lockdown everyone participated in the decoration of the shelters creating a festive and warm atmosphere for all children enabling a feeling of belonging and celebration during the holidays. During the Covid-19 pandemic The HOME Project remains dedicated to ensuring positive environments for all children under our care. #nochildalone Η περίοδος των Χριστουγέννων έφτασε και παρά το lockdown, όλοι συμμετείχαν στο στολισμό των ξενώνων δημιουργώντας μια γιορτινή και ζεστή ατμόσφαιρα για τα παιδιά, επιτρέποντας τους έτσι το αίσθημα να ανήκουν και να διασκεδάσουν κατά τη διάρκεια των γιορτών. Κατά τη διάρκεια της πανδημίας του Covid-19 στη The HOME Project παραμένουμε αφοσιωμένοι στη διασφάλιση ενός θετικού περιβάλλοντος για όλα τα παιδιά που βρίσκονται στη φροντίδα μας. #nochildalone
column47: Photos from The HOME Project's post

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: This past week, the first family reunification was carried out in ‘Daphne’ home for unaccompanied minor girls and minor mothers with their babies which we run in collaboration with Movement On The Ground. Both the girls and staff of ‘Daphne’ will miss her dearly and as a reminder, made a card for her just before she left. We have nothing but warmth in our heart for this news and we are looking forward to welcoming a new girl in the shelter. We are very grateful to all our supporters and will continue our efforts in providing the most healing conditions for these children on their journey to a brighter future. In an effort to provide more safe and enabling environments for vulnerable lone children in Greece, Movement On The Ground and The HOME Project have partnered to open three shelters for unaccompanied minors in Athens. #nochildalone Την περασμένη εβδομάδα, η πρώτη υπόθεση οικογενειακής επανένωσης ολοκληρώθηκε με επιτυχία στο νέο μας ξενώνα «Δάφνη» που φιλοξενεί ασυνόδευτα ανήλικα κορίτσια και ανήλικες μητέρες με τα μωρά τους και τον οποίο λειτουργούμε σε συνεργασία με το Movement On The Ground. Επειδή θα λείψει στα κορίτσια όσο και στο προσωπικό της έφτιαξαν και της χάρισαν μια αναμνηστική κάρτα λίγο πριν φύγει. Νιώθουμε ζεστασιά στην καρδιά μας για τα υπέροχα αυτά νέα και ανυπομονούμε να υποδεχτούμε το νέο μας κορίτσι στο ξενώνα. Ευχαριστούμε θερμά όλους τους υποστηρικτές μας και θα συνεχίσουμε τις προσπάθειές μας να παρέχουμε τις πιο κατάλληλες θεραπευτικές συνθήκες για αυτά τα παιδιά στη πορεία τους για ένα καλύτερο μέλλον. Σε μια προσπάθεια να παρέχουν ασφαλές περιβάλλον για τα παιδιά που βρίσκονται στην Ελλάδα μόνα τους, το Movement On The Ground και το HOME Project συνεργάζονται για το άνοιγμα και τη λειτουργία τριών ξενώνων για ασυνόδευτα παιδιά στην Αθήνα. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Despite the nationwide lockdown, many of the children under our care have still managed to find ways to exercise, as it is essential to maintaining good physical and mental health. Here, one of the older children under our care jumps rope with a beautiful backdrop of the city and the shelter’s urban garden behind him. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: On Giving Tuesday, we are reminded that every child deserves opportunity, security, and happiness. At The HOME Project we shelter and empower lone refugee children to lead healthy and productive lives. Please consider donating to The HOME Project this Giving Tuesday by clicking the link on our website. #nochildalone #givingtuesday https://www.homeproject.org/en/get-involved/

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: “Every child is an artist” (Picasso) During this quarantine the thirst for creativity and freedom of expression have turned small corners of our shelters into artists’ studio enabling our children and staff to explore their talents and beautiful ideas. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: We are grateful to Mediterraneo Hospital and Οφθαλμική Διάγνωση - Ophthalmic Diagnosis with Dr. George Stamas who undertook pro bono the hospitalization and cataract surgery of one of the children we care for at The HOME Project for the second time. Mahmoud arrived in one of our shelters in need of surgeries for both of his eyes, the first of which he received last year. Today, thanks to the kindness of Dr. Stamas and Mediterraneo Hospital, Mahmoud is in good health and ready to take the next step into adulthood with our support. #nochildalone Είμαστε ευγνώμονες στο Mediterraneo Hospital και στην Οφθαλμική Διάγνωση - Ophthalmic Diagnosis και τον γιατρό κ. Γιώργο Στάμα που για δεύτερη φορά ανέλαβαν αφιλοκερδώς τα νοσήλια και την χειρουργική επέμβαση καταρράκτη ενός από τα παιδιά που φροντίζουμε στη The HOME Project. O Mahmoud έφτασε πριν τρία χρόνια σε έναν από τους 14 ξενώνες μας έχοντας την ανάγκη χειρουργικής επέμβασης και στα δύο μάτια του, όπου το πρώτο το χειρούργησε πέρυσι. Σήμερα με την ευγενική προσφορά του γιατρού κ. Στάμα και του MediterraneoHospital ο Mahmoud, ως ενήλικος πλέον, είναι υγιής και έτοιμος για το επόμενο βήμα προς την αυτονόμηση του πάντα με την υποστήριξη μας.

column18: We improve the lives of vulnerable children by funding, elevating and educating the most effective changemakers for children worldwide.
column43: Today marks United Nations Chernobyl Remembrance Day and the 35th anniversary of the disaster. Join the global lighting event to send a message of Hope to the victims of Chernobyl to say to them, We will not forget you. And today we honor our HERO, Adi Roche of Chernobyl Children International for her lifetime dedication to bring hope to the children still suffering the affects of the disaster.❤️🙏🏼 #chernobly35 #IWillNotForgetYou #chernobylchildreninternational #worldofchildrenhero #hope

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: With the holiday spirit in the air, the children in one of the shelters took on a baking project. They began by crafting outlines of shapes and then eventually baked delicious sugar cookies that disappeared almost as fast as they came out of the oven. These sorts of activities in the shelters are beloved by the children and staff alike, bringing the whole community within the HOME closer together. #nochildalone

column18: We believe in a world where no child goes to bed hungry.
column43: A great way to end the week: serving struggling families. A great way to begin a new week: seeing the kindness of those serving struggling families. <3 Thank you First United Bank and First United Bank! #ThankYou #Community
column48: We were happy to partner with Feed the Children and Boomarang Diner to bring the Teacher Store to Shawnee! This week some of our team went to help stuff bags of supplies and other goodies for the teachers in the Shawnee area.  We love our educators and think it's so important to treat them in any way we can.  Show the teachers in your lives a little extra love as they prepare to head back to school over the next few weeks!

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: #InternationalHumanRightsDay, reminds us of the respect and care every child deserves. Today our thoughts go out to the more than 2,200 unaccompanied minors who currently remain outside of a system of protection in Greece, whose personal rights are constantly under threat. In times like these, it is important that we each recognize the common humanity that links us all together and to ask ourselves what we can do for these children. #nochildalone The HOME Project

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: We are thrilled to announce the opening of another home in Athens together with Movement On The Ground as well as welcoming the first children. "Thiseas", a home for unaccompanied teenage boys, has a capacity of 16 and is now full of life after the arrival of the first children. The creation of this safe and healing home is yet another milestone in our joint mission to provide holistic, individualized care and child protection services for unaccompanied children on the move. #nochildalone In an effort to provide more safe and enabling environments for vulnerable lone children in Greece, Movement On The Ground and The HOME Project have partnered to open three shelters for unaccompanied minors in Athens.

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: The HOME Project CEO Sofia Kouvelaki held a virtual discussion with students from London Business School as part of their Global Assignment Program. Every year, senior students and leaders from London Business School connect with The HOME Project to support our work and learn more about the situation on the ground. We would like to thank them for their continued interest in our mission, and we hope to be able to also engage in person with their students when this is possible. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: On International Migrants Day, we recognize and appreciate the significance of people and children who bring their skills and diversity to our community and we work to ensure their right to a bright future. The HOME Project was founded in 2016 to address the needs of lone refugee children who arrive in Greece and 4 years later, a total of more than 570 children in 14 shelters have received comprehensive child protection services, care and chance for a better life. We are extremely grateful to all our partners and friends who have enabled us to provide protection and care for these children. Thank you for joining us in this journey. #NoChildAlone #InternationalMigrantsDay #4thanniversary

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: This past Sunday one of our shelter coordinators dressed up as Santa Claus and offered wonderful gifts and beautiful smiles to younger children under our care. The kids were delighted and his presence brought them a lot of joy during the holiday season. Part of our mission is to integrate these children by engaging them in activities that will make them feel like children again. Laughter and amusement are certainly crucial elements in that. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Some of the children under our care have created stunning holiday cards to thank our friends and supporters for the love and compassion they have shown this year. With 3d designs, creating these took significant time, but the outcome is definitely worth the effort as the children were extremely proud of their work. #nochildalone
column47: Photos from The HOME Project's post

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: The HOME Project children in collaboration with WWF Greece and Waterbags – Watermasks designed and produced protection masks against Covid-19 during the quarantine period. In view of Christmas spirit the children decided to offer the masks to the people of Shedia street paper in Athens and Thessaloniki. The synergy is aiming to raise children's awareness on environmental and social issues while giving them the opportunity to offer back to the community and express their solidarity amidst these challenging times. #nochildalone #PandaParea Τα παιδιά της The HOME Project με την υποστήριξη του WWF Greece και των Waterbags - WaterMasks σχεδιάζουν εν μέσω καραντίνας και ενόψει των εορτών υφασμάτινες μάσκες προστασίας ενάντια στον Covid-19 ώστε να τις προσφέρουν στους ανθρώπους της Shedia – Περιοδικό Δρόμου σε Αθήνα και Θεσσαλονίκη. Η συνέργεια αυτή στοχεύει στην ευαισθητοποίηση των παιδιών σε περιβαλλοντικά αλλά και κοινωνικά ζητήματα. Παράλληλα στόχος είναι να τους δοθεί η δυνατότητα να προσφέρουν σε συνανθρώπους τους και να εκφράσουν την αλληλεγγύη τους σε αυτή την δύσκολη περίοδο για όλους.

column43: Last week, one of our babies from Pugad shelter turned one-year old. Staff and children from the shelter contributed to make her day special by coloring the home and sharing good vibes. We wish her happy birthday and we are looking forward to seeing her growing up. #nochildalone

column43: During the holidays season The HOME Project shelter staff and children decorated and set up Christmas trees. In one of our shelter for minor girls and minor mothers with their babies, this particular tree has a sparkle with ornaments that have fascinated one of the babies. #nochildalone

column43: The HOME Project and the two latest arrivals in our shelters would like to wish everyone a Happy New Year as we move into 2021. Despite the hard times we have all experienced during the past 9 months, we hope that this year will be brighter and more joyous. A big thank you to our partners and supporters for enabling us to continue serving the children under our care despite all challenges. #nochildalone

Rescue Foundation India rescues, rehabilitates , and repatriates girls who are victims of sexual trafficking. Thank you Triveni for your life saving work protecting and empowering thousands of girls 🙏🏼 Please donate so that we may continue supporting our World of Children Heroes on the ground with emergency Covid relief!

column43: Children in our shelters have restarted their online classes and they are working hard on their schoolwork collaborating with one another. Education is vital for the proper growth of children and it plays key role in the efforts toward social inclusion. Going to school was already a challenge for many refugee children worldwide, even before Covid-19 pandemic and we hope all children will be able to have access to their inalienable rights of proper care and education. #nochildalone #educationforall

column43: The HOME Project children were inspired by nature during their participation in environmental awareness workshops delivered in collaboration with WWF Greece and created drawings with their wishes for the people of Shedia - Street Paper. The drawings then turned into protection masks against Covid-19 with the support of Waterbags – Watermasks and will be distributed to the people of Shedia - Street Paper in Athens and Thessaloniki. Τα παιδιά της The HOME Project εμπνευσμένα από τη φύση κατά τη διάρκεια των εργαστηρίων περιβαλλοντικής ευαισθητοποίησης, που πραγματοποιήθηκαν σε συνεργασία με το WWF Ελλάς, ζωγράφισαν σχέδια και έγραψαν ευχές για τους ανθρώπους της Σχεδίας – Περιοδικό Δρόμου . Στη συνέχεια, οι ζωγραφιές και οι ευχές με την υποστήριξη των WaterMasks μετατράπηκαν σε υφασμάτινες μάσκες προστασίας ενάντια στον Covid-19, για να διαμοιραστούν με τη βοήθεια της Σχεδίας – Περιοδικό Δρόμου στους ανθρώπους της σε Αθήνα και Θεσσαλονίκη.

column43: We are thrilled to announce the launch of a social integration project supported by Al Madad Foundation involving specialized technical training and skills development in combination with Greek language acquisition for teenagers in our shelters reaching adulthood. One of the key tools for social integration is professional rehabilitation. This project will enable youth employability by ensuring access to equal opportunities. #nochildalone #activecitizenship #socialintegration #youthempowerment https://www.almadadfoundation.org/

column43: January’s staff capacity building training was conducted in collaboration with UNHCR GREECE on the topic of gender based violence. The session, which was held online, was centered around the identifications of signs of gender based violence and the presentation of different models of functional management and treatment. Empowering our staff to improve their ability to provide high quality care and protection services to children in the shelters is key priority in our mission. #nochildalone

column43: The HOME Project is proud to share the news that our CEO Sofia Kouvelaki has been selected as a shortlisted Candidate at Social Responsibility category at the Greek International Women Awards along with women who act for the benefit of society. Click on the link and vote for The HOME Project CEO Sofia Kouvelaki under the social responsibility category. https://greekinternationalwomenawards.com/shortlisted-candidates/ You can support us in this opportunity to continue creating impactful changes in the life of the children we care for. #nochildalone #GIWAwards #GIWAPublicVoting #Greekinternationalwomenawards Με χαρά ανακοινώνουμε ότι η Σοφία Κουβελάκη CEO της The HOME Project είναι υποψήφια για το βραβείο Greek International Women Awards στην κατηγορία Social Responsibility, μαζί με γυναίκες που δραστηριοποιούνται για ευεργετικούς κοινωνικούς σκοπούς. Ακολουθώντας τον παρακάτω σύνδεσμο, μπορείτε να στηρίξετε την υποψηφιότητα της αναδεικνύοντας το έργο και τη δέσμευση της The HOME Project στην φροντίδα των πιο ευάλωτων παιδιών. https://greekinternationalwomenawards.com/shortlisted-candidates/

column43: Due to COVID-19 lockdowns, students across Greece have to continue their education virtually. This includes teenage girls and minor mothers with their babies living in our Daphne Home in Athens, which we operate in collaboration with Movement On The Ground. We would like to thank PXP Embassy e.V. for their donation of laptops providing access to virtual classes, and additional digital literacy courses. As the world continues to adjust to this new digital reality the need to ensure equal access to education for all children becomes one of our priorities. #nochildalone #educationforall

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Children under The HOME Project care participated in a personal health workshop delivered in collaboration with IOM Greece. It is of vital importance for teenagers to feel safe, learn how to remain healthy and take care of their body. We thank IOM Greece for these useful lessons. #nochildalone Τα παιδιά της The HOME Project συμμετείχαν σε ένα εκπαιδευτικό εργαστήριο προσωπικής υγείας που υλοποιήθηκε σε συνεργασία με τον IOM Greece, τον οποίο ευχαριστούμε πολύ. Είναι εξαιρετικής σημασίας για τους εφήβους να αισθάνονται ασφαλείς, να μάθουν πώς να παραμένουν υγιείς και να φροντίζουν το σώμα τους. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: The HOME Project staff encourage children to participate in recreational activities. Spending quality time with one another in shelters helps the children to foster strong relationships. Chess is one of their favorite past times and strengthens problem-solving skills. #nochildalone Το προσωπικό της The HOME Project ενθαρρύνει καθημερινά τα παιδιά να συμμετέχουν σε ψυχαγωγικές δραστηριότητες, περνώντας ποιοτικό χρόνο και αναπτύσσοντας ισχυρές σχέσεις μεταξύ τους. Το σκάκι είναι μία από τις αγαπημένες τους ασχολίες που ενισχύει και δεξιότητες τους στην επίλυση προβλημάτων. #nochildalone

column43: As we remain in a state of lockdown, all children at The HOME Project shelters need daily support. We are looking for volunteers to provide online Greek and English lessons, as well as online dance classes (preferably hip-hop). Come join us in our mission to create positive learning environments for these children. All we need is your positive energy and commitment for at least 3 months. At the start of your volunteering, you will be trained by our Child Protection Unit. Please contact us at info@homeproject.org #nochildalone

This milestone marks another step in our joint mission to provide holistic care and individualized child protection services to unaccompanied children in need. #nochildalone In an effort to provide more safe and enabling environments for vulnerable lone children in Greece, Movement On The Ground and The HOME Project have partnered to open three shelters for unaccompanied minors in Athens.

The sweets represent a cultural bridge for the children under The HOME Project care to become familiar with Greek customs and the celebration of Koulouma. We also extend a big thank you to Konstantinos Dedes, President at Τεχνόπολη Δήμου Αθηναίων - Technopolis City of Athens, for making this happen. #nochildalone

column43: The HOME Project extends its gratitude to HAEF Athens College - Psychico College for offering preparatory lessons in order to prepare children under our care for entrance exam classes for the next academic year. We strongly believe that every child has the right to education and the opportunity to succeed. #educationforall #nochildalone The HOME Project ευχαριστεί ιδιαιτέρως το HAEF Athens College - Psychico College και τους καθηγητές του που προσφέρουν ενισχυτική διδασκαλία σε παιδιά που βρίσκονται κάτω από τη φροντίδα μας, προετοιμάζοντάς τους για τις εξετάσεις εισαγωγής στο επόμενο σχολικό έτος. Πιστεύουμε ακράδαντα ότι κάθε παιδί έχει δικαίωμα στην εκπαίδευση και ανοιχτή πρόσβαση σε ίσες ευκαιρίες για το μέλλον του. #educationforall #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: A big thank you to Ελληνικός Ερυθρός Σταυρός - Hellenic Red Cross for its continuous support via the provision of vaccinations for children under our care. Securing equal access to health care for all children is crucial element of our work. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: On International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination, The HOME Project stands against racism and discrimination everywhere. With this year’s official theme being “youth standing up against racism”, we remind ourselves that children will shape the future of our world, and we reaffirm our belief in their ability to make it a better place. #FightRacism #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: On a weekly basis children under The HOME Project care participate in art groups. These beautiful pieces of artwork focused on values that the girls hold dear to themselves and beliefs that make up part of who they are. These values, from love to autonomy, represent the strength of these children to take back their childhood and shape a future for themselves. We are so proud of them. #nochildalone
column47: Photos from The HOME Project's post

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: We were very happy to virtually welcome the Dutch Minister for Migration Ankie Broekers-Knol, to the newest shelter opened in collaboration with Movement On The Ground. We are grateful to her for enabling us to help more children in need via the provision of child protection services and the appropriate care. We were thrilled to introduce her to the kids, our shelter staff and share with her the hard work that has been done to prepare and operate this new home where these teenagers will be protected and supported towards obtaining equal access to opportunities allowing them to build a future for themselves. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Join us to support our educational development programs for children under our care. We are looking for primary school educators to volunteer in providing monthly online lessons (minimum of 3 month commitment) in Greek, English and Maths to the children under our care for their entrance to the 1st year of Middle school (Gymnasium). Before the volunteering, our child protection unit will provide training, followed by continuous supervision and support. Please contact us at info@homeproject.org #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: A big thank you to ΥΓΕΙΑ for providing a pro-bono surgery for S., a child under our care. We are incredibly grateful for their kindness in undertaking this surgery, and it marks a significant milestone in a long road to fully addressing S.’s health. #nochildalone Ένα μεγάλο ευχαριστώ στο ΥΓΕΙΑ που ανέλαβε αφιλοκερδώς τη χειρουργική επέμβαση ενός από τα παιδιά που φροντίζουμε στη The HOME Project. Είμαστε ευγνώμονες για την ευγενική προσφορά τους και την πραγματοποίηση αυτής της επέμβασης που σηματοδοτεί ένα σημαντικό σταθμό στον μακρύ δρόμο για την πλήρη αντιμετώπιση της κατάστασης της υγείας του S. #nochildalone

column46: We are proud that our CEO, Sofia Kouvelak is a member of the first class of Obama Foundation Leaders: Europe-a program that connected her with other talented leaders to work together to create the change we want to see in our communities and beyond. Their meeting with Barack Obama filled us all with hope and energy to continue our work.

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Children under our care found hatha yoga and sound therapy a perfect way to maintain a healthy body and mind by simultaneously focusing on their balance. These sessions are conducted by our care taker in the shelter. Especially, during a period of staying at home, these activities are beneficial for one’s mental health and contribute to The HOME Project provision of care for the children. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: As part of our ongoing commitment to maintaining close relationships with the communities around the shelters, children under our care, from the Thiseas home operated in collaboration with Movement On The Ground, created their own masks and offered them at local shops around the shelters. Community outreach benefits both the neighborhood and the children in the shelters, breaking down xenophobic barriers and stereotypes while bringing everyone closer together. #nochildalone
column47: Photos from The HOME Project's post

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: As part of The HOME Project child protection services, children attend weekly meetings with members of the legal team. Legal support is a key aspect of our child protection model. The team remains dedicated to supporting the children in the entire legal process for granting international protection or reunification with their families in another EU country, especially with the external administrative challenges exacerbated by COVID-19 measures. It is crucial that the children receive legal aid in order to be represented in all degrees of their asylum procedure. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: We would like to thank the Fidel Götz Stiftung and Caritas Österreich for their generous donation enabling us the continuation of the operation of two shelters: one for younger children, and one for girls and minor mothers with their babies. Their support directly contributes to the continued provision of child protection services and holistic care for unaccompanied children. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: High School (lykeion) students under our care returned to in person schooling this week following every safety precaution, including consistent use of COVID-19 self-tests. Especially during these challenging times it is extremely important to safeguard all children’s inalienable right to education, while ensuring equal access to healthcare and social support. #nochildalone #educationforall

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Tune in on Saturday, April 17th and listen to Sofia Kouvelaki, CEO of The HOME Project participating in a one day two-panel program on the effects of the Pandemic, Citizenship and the Eastern Mediterranean hosted by Institute of Eastern Mediterranean Studies at Emmanuel College in cooperation with The Constantine G. Karamanlis Chair in Hellenic and European Studies. The two-panel program will bring mayors, public policy and health experts from the region to discuss the policy approaches and implementation in dealing with the Covid-19 pandemic over the last year. We invite you to join the event with the following zoom link. #nochildalone Link: https://emmanuel.zoom.us/j/j91483010715
column46: George E. Danis Leadership Seminar Pandemic and Citizenship in the Mediterranean City Mayors, Citizenship, Covid-19 in the Mediterranean City 9:00 EDT/16.00 (GMT+3) Athens, Greece Mr. Kostas Bakoyannis, Mayor Mr. Constantinos Yiorkadjis, Mayor Mr. Francesco Italia, Mayor of Siracusa Italy Nicosia, Cyprus Health and Public Policy the Age of Covid-19 12:00 (EDT)/19.00 (GMT+3) Dr. Natalia Linos, Executive Director, Harvard University FXB Center Dr. Eirini Iliaki, CHA, Harvard Medical School Dr. Fotini Christia, Director, MIT Sociotechnical Systems Research Center Ms. Sofia Kouvelaki, CEO, The Home Project Saturday, April 17, 2021 Zoom #s/ee.om/148010715 EMMANUEL COLLEGE Institute Eastern Mediterranean

column43: The HOME Project fosters spaces where creativity can flourish in the minds of children. The youngest children under our care have created their own space for expression, contributing to a safe and healing environment. We look forward to seeing them continue to express themselves. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Sajid, an independent adult now, came into one of our shelters for unaccompanied minor boys four years ago. His story is an example of social inclusion achieved through tailored support and equal access to opportunities. During his four-year stay, and due to his willingness to study, he has been granted a scholarship at ACS Athens (American Community Schools) and learned Greek and English. Today we are proud to have him working in one of our shelters for teenage boys as a caregiver and interpreter. At The HOME Project, offering employment opportunities to young adults is a key step towards social inclusion. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
column43: Children under our care participated in a workshop delivered by members of our staff on healthy eating habits and the Mediterranean diet. One of the aims of the workshop was to increase awareness around the importance of engaging in healthy eating habits and how to make a real difference in our ability to remain active and enjoy life to its fullest. We aim to always implement the best practices to ensure the safety and health of the children we care for. #nochildalone

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.

Agricultural educational activities build a strong sense of community and empower children to understand social and environmental values necessary for shaping a better future for society as a whole. #nochildalone #onehomeoneplanet

column18: The HOME Project is a non-profit organization set up to address the needs of unaccompanied refugee children.
